article: As the son of an ordinary farmer, Wu Yulu left school at an early age. _ preferred playing with machines to reading books in his childhood. When he was just 8 years old, he made his first mini-electrical machine. He showed great interest in making _ . In the eyes of local villagers, Wu Yulu was crazy. _ , he never gave up his dream. He _ most of his time making robots and didn't care about farming. He has _ more than thirty robots with various functions. Some clean, some wash the dishes, and others light cigarettes, pour water or serve food. "I will never _ making robots and I'm glad that I have kept on. In 2009, I was invited to a(n) _ in Shijiazhuang, the capital of Hebei Province, with my robots. I am so _ that my works were exhibited along with Shenzhou VII." Influenced by Wu Yulu, his son Wu Wangyang _ loves robots. The young man is a college student, majoring in software design, and always helps his father make robots. In the future, he and his father Wu Yulu will surely invent robots that are more advanced.
